newsitem.title: UK: Xerox seen eyeing Eurodollar bond -dealers.
newsitem.headline: Xerox seen eyeing Eurodollar bond -dealers.

text.p: Xerox Credit Corp could soon launch a dollar Eurobond off its medium-term note programme, syndicate managers said on Friday.
"It is likely to be for between $200 and $250 million at around a three- to five-year maturity," a syndicate manager at a U.S. bank said.
"They are going to expect a very tight retail execution following this week's IBM deal, which has tightened to 12 b.p. over...Xerox will expect this kind level.
"But Xerox is not as strong a name for European retail investors as IBM is," he said.
"Xerox is not going to be an easy deal, but in the absence of other better corporate issues, the deal will fare okay," he added.
Xerox is rated A2 by Moody's Investors Service and A by Standard & Poor's Corp.
IBM Corp launched a $250 million three-year bond to yield 15 b.p. over U.S. Treasuries on Wednesday via SBC Warburg. IBM is rated A1 by Moody's and A by S&P.
Xerox Credit Corp launched a $150 million three-year Eurobond in May last year via Citibank International.
The paper was priced to yield 12 b.p. over U.S. Treasuries.
Citibank and Lehman Brothers were in the running to lead-manage the imminent Xerox transaction, dealers said.
